definition: the act of departing politely, leave unchanged or undisturbed or refrain from taking
details:
noun
- the act of departing politely
= synonyms: farewell
- permission to do something
= example: permission to do something
= synonyms: consent
- the period of time during which you are absent from work or duty
= example: the period of time during which you are absent from work or duty
= synonyms: leave of absence
verb
- leave unchanged or undisturbed or refrain from taking
= example: leave unchanged or undisturbed or refrain from taking
= synonyms: leave alone
- be survived by after one's death
= synonyms: leave behind
- leave behind unintentionally
= synonyms: forget
- go and leave behind, either intentionally or by neglect or forgetfulness
- go away from a place
= example: go away from a place
= synonyms: go away, go forth
- move out of or depart from
= example: move out of or depart from
= synonyms: exit
- leave or give by will after one's death
= synonyms: will, bequeath
- put into the care or protection of someone
= synonyms: entrust
- remove oneself from an association with or participation in
= example: remove oneself from an association with or participation in
= synonyms: depart, pull up stakes
- have as a result or residue
= synonyms: lead, result
- make a possibility or provide opportunity for
= synonyms: provide, allow, allow for
- act or be so as to become in a specified state
- have left or have as a remainder
